data.15: Speed Restricted to 15 Miles per Hour
data.25: Speed Restricted to 25 Miles per Hour
data.35: Speed Restricted to 35 Miles per Hour
data.45: Speed Restricted to 45 Miles per Hour
data.AAS: Attendants Accompanying - Rail service for government or contractor personnel accompanying freight shipments on freight trains
data.ADL: Advance Loading - Service for advanced loading of bulk fuel
data.AFN: Air Craft Furnished and Not Used
data.AIB: Additional Injection/Blending Service - Service for providing additional pipeline injection/blending service
data.ANC: Anchoring and Unanchoring - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to perform unanchoring services on a mobile home at one location and anchoring services at another location after transportation has been performed
data.APD: Additional Copy of Shipping Papers for Proof of Delivery
data.APL: Appliance Servicing - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to service used household goods appliances by securing the item in such a nammer that it withstand handling and transportation
data.ARC: Air Conditioning Disconnect and Connect - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to disconnect an air conditioning unit attached to a mobile home and reconnecting the air conditioner after transportation from one location to another has been performed
data.AUX: Auxiliary Service - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to provide exclusive use of a vehicle as part of the movement of a household goods shipment
data.BKA: Bulky Article - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to service motorcycles, tractors, riding lawn mowers, privately owned vehicles, and other personal effects of unusual size or nature by securing the item in such a manner that will withstand handling and transportation
data.BLS: Blind Shipment - Shipper's name inserted in place of the manufacturer's name on the shipping papers
data.BOX: Boxing Service - Dry Bulk - Carrier responsible for transferring product into boxes at the point of delivery
data.CCB: Convert Commercial Bill of Lading (BOL) to Government BOL
data.CCS: Carrier Caboose - Service for carrier-furnished caboose
data.CF: Container, Factory Load - Full container, not to be opened for consolidation
data.CGC: Carrier Guard Car Service - Rail service for each carrier guard car used by attendants accompanying freight shipments
data.CGR: Return Carrier Guard Car Service - Rail service when an unoccupied guard car is returned to a location other than the original shipping point
data.CHN: Chain and Binders - Motor service when more than eight sets are required to secure a shipment to flat bed equipment
data.CO: No Marshalling Required for Hazardous Materials
data.COR: Certification That the Newsprint Winding Cores Being Returned Empty Were Received Filled by Rail Freight Service
data.CSP: Government Caboose - Service for carrier-furnished caboose for use by government personnel
data.CTM: Container Mounting - Carrier mounts container onto chassis
data.CY: Certification that this Shipment is for Recycling as Defined in Applicable Tariffs Containing Such Provisions
data.DBL: Double Wide Separate and Reassemble - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to separate each unit of a double-wide mobile home and prepare for movement and reassemble the double-wide mobile home after transportation from one location to another has been performed
data.DBP: Delivery of Fuel From Barge to Pipeline
data.DDN: Dual Driver with National Agency Check - A type of security service where a carrier must allow the government to perform a National Agency Check (NAC) on all personnel involved in a government shipment
data.DDZ: Drayage at Port of Debarkation (Rate Zone)
data.DEP: Detention of Conveying Equipment and the Power Unit - May be ordered by consignee at time of loading
data.DET: Detention of Conveying Equipment Excluding the Power Unit - May be ordered at time of loading
data.DEZ: Drayage at Port of Embarkation (Rate Zone)
data.DFM: 410 Dromedary with Mechanical Restraining Devices - A service where the carrier furnishes a 410 cubic foot dromedary which is equipped with properly installed mechanical restraints and devices for the blocking and bracing of freight
data.DFS: 410 Dromedary - Demountable 410 cu. ft. shipping container that can be fastened to the chassis of a truck, tractor, or flat bed
data.DLP: Delivery of Fuel From Rail Tank Car to Pipeline
data.DLR: Notify Shipper Immediately if Shipment is Delayed en Route
data.DN: Shipper Authorization Required for Diversion or Consignment
data.DNC: Do Not Couple to Other Diaphragmed Cars
data.DNF: Do Not Freeze - Specifies that the temperature of a shipment must not go below the freezing point during transit
data.DNT: Do Not Couple to Tank Cars
data.DOC: Documentation - Special - Carrier creates special shipper documentation
data.DPB: Delivery of Fuel From Pipeline to Barge
data.DPL: Delivery of Fuel From Pipeline to Rail Tank Car
data.DPT: Delivery of Fuel From Pipeline to Tank Truck or Trailer
data.DPU: Detention With Power Units (30 minute periods)
data.DRU: Drumming Service - Carrier responsible for transferring product into drums at the point of delivery
data.DS: Delivery Only on Surrender of Written Order
data.DSK: Do Not Couple to Double Shelf Couples
data.DSM: Dromedary with Mechanical Restraining Devices - A service where the carrier furnishes a regular size dromedary which is equipped with properly installed mechanical restraints and devices for the blocking and bracing of freight
data.DSV: Door Side Vanning - The cargo is to be placed in the container adjacent to the door
data.DTB: Labor Associated with Detention of Conveying Equipment - May be ordered by shipper at time of loading
data.DTP: Delivery of Fuel From Tank Truck or Trailer to Pipeline
data.DTV: Detention (Vehicle) - Rail service when rail owned/leased trailers/containers on flat cars are detained for loading/unloading
data.DWP: Detention With Power Units (60 minute periods)
data.EAX: Extra Axles - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to install and rent an axle with wheels, tires and brakes required for the transportation of a mobile home
data.ECS: Empty Railcar Ordered But Not Used
data.ED: Excessive Dimensions - Equipment exceeds operating restrictions but is not considered high/wide in interline movement
data.EDD: Equipment Hose at Destination - Service for supplying special hose equipment for dispatching bulk fuel at destination
data.EDO: Equipment Hose at Origin - Service for supplying special hose equipment for dispatching bulk fuel at origin
data.EED: Exclusive Use - Charge when vehicle furnished is devoted exclusively to transportation of a shipment without breaking of seals
data.EL: Environmental Control Limits - The items contained in the shipment are subject to environmental controls whose limits are specified in the contract
data.ELS: Extra Lights - Motor service when a state agency requires extra lights be placed on an overdimensional shipment
data.EMR: Emergency Service - Carrier provides special services in case of emergency
data.EMT: Empty Movement - Motor service when empty movement of equipment is required
data.ERS: Empty Return - Motor service when empty equipment is returned from the destination to point of origin
data.EV: Damages Incurred if Shipment Fails to Meet Vessel Loading
data.EXO: Export Preparation - Carrier must prepare shipment for export
data.EXQ: Expedited Service - Motor service for the immediate dispatch of equipment in continuous line-haul service to meet delivery schedules
data.EXT: Extra Labor - Carrier must supply additional labor
data.EXZ: Expand Remove and Install - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to prepare, separate, and seal an expando room attached to a mobile home prior to movement and secure the room at destination after the transportation from one location to another has been performed
data.FC: Moving Under "For Furtherance Instructions" and May Be Delivered
data.FCS: Furnishing Chassis - Rail service when chassis are furnished by carrier to effect pickup or delivery of containers on flat cars
data.FRZ: Accepted by Carrier at Owner's Risk of Freezing
data.FTR: Filtration Service - Service for providing pipeline filtration service
data.GOC: Government-Owned Containers - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to utilize containers provided by the U. S. Government for movement of used personal property belongings to U. S. Government employees
data.GSP: Government Guard Car - Service for carrier-furnished guard car for use by government personnel
data.HBR: Hand Brakes at Each End Must Be Released
data.HDH: Shipment Holdover for Holidays - Shipments may be held over on holidays for delivery the following normal workday morning when requested by the shipper; applicable for perishable subsistence
data.HDW: Shipment Holdover for Weekends - Friday pickups may be held over for Monday morning delivery when requested by the shipper for the convenience of the consignee; applicable for perishable subsistence
data.HEA: Heat in Transit - Carrier required to keep product heated during transit
data.HES: Heat - Special - Carrier required to keep product heated during transit in accordance with special instructions provided
data.HET: Heat With Steam - Carrier required to keep product heated with steam during transit
data.HOL: Sunday or Holiday Pickup or Delivery
data.HOR: 24 Hour Availability - Loading and unloading site is open 24 hours a day
data.HRS: Heater or Refrigeration - Rail service when shipments of commodities require protective service from the heat or cold
data.ID: Shipment to be Inspected at Destination and Disposition Instructions will be Furnished
data.IMP: Impactographs - Motor service when impactographs are provided at the request of the shipper or consignee
data.INT: Intra-Plant Move - Carrier requested to provide equipment and labor for intra-plant work
data.KEG: Certification that the Containers Being Returned Empty Were Received Filled by Rail Freight Service
data.LAB: Labor Disturbance - Labor disturbance at plant
data.LAY: Layover - Carrier equipment and driver required to layover
data.LBL: Apply a Uniform Code Council/International Article Numbering Association (UCC/EAN) Serial Shipping Container Label to the Shipping Containers
data.LC2: Land Currency Adjustment Factor - 20 Foot Container
data.LHS: Linehaul Service - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to provide special linehaul services; i.e. to or from a temporary storage site, for used household goods not included in the normal transportation from origin to destination locations
data.LMD: Liner Terms at Port of Debarkation
data.LME: Liner Terms at Port of Embarkation
data.MEN: Escort Service with Overnight Subsistence - Motor service when movement hour restrictions require an escort vehicle driver or flagmen to stay overnight
data.MET: Escort Services (Telephone) - Motor service when shipper/consignee requests that vehicles be equipped with mobile telephones or two-way radios
data.MVS: Special Motor Surveillance - Motor security service which provides shipper with extraordinary visibility of their shipments in transit
data.NHC: Do not Hump or Hump into
data.NHL: Do Not Use Helper Locomotive to Push
data.NSV: Nose Side Vanning - The cargo is to be placed in the container at the end furthest from the door
data.NW: In Case of Fire Do Not Use Water
data.OAH: Stow Away from Heat - The container is to be stowed away from any source of heat
data.ODI: Stow with Doors Facing Inward - The container is to be stowed with the doors facing towards the midline of the vessel
data.OFH: In Front of House Stowage - The container is to be stowed on deck forward of the superstructure of the vessel
data.OFU: Fumigation - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to fumigate a household goods shipment that is insect infested
data.OIL: Oil Field Service - Special services required to deliver freight at oil field site
data.OS: Commodity Loaded Less Than or Equal To the Car Ordered
data.OTD: Time of Delivery and Signature Required
data.OTH: On Top In-hatch Stowage - The container is to be stowed as the top-most container of those stowed within a hatch
data.OTO: On Top On-deck Stowage - The container is to be stowed as the top-most container of those stowed on-deck
data.OUC: Under Container On-deck Stowage - The container is to be stowed below another container on the deck of the vessel
data.OUW: Below Water Line Stowage - The container is to be stowed below the waterline of the vessel
data.PAV: Pickup of Shipments on Saturday, Sunday, and/or Holidays Requiring Absolute Next Day Delivery
data.PD: Privately Controlled Private Equipment Subject to Demurrage
data.PDS: Pickup and Delivery From Storage in Transit - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to pickup a household goods shipment at, or deliver to a temporary storage facility
data.PDY: Pickup and Delivery Beyond Service Area
data.PER: Special Permits - Carrier required to provide special permits in order to move freight
data.PIR: Pier Time - Carrier required to wait at pier for loading or unloading
data.PMS: Pickup of Shipments Requiring Same Day Delivery Service
data.PMT: Pickup of Shipments Requiring Same Day Delivery Service and/or Delivery at a Specified Time
data.POC: Piano/Organ Carry - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to provide special handling and transportation for a piano or organ as part of a household goods shipment
data.PPD: Pickup and Delivery Service for Perishables
data.PRL: Prelodge - Motor service for hand delivery of shipping documents 24 hours or more prior to the delivery of a shipment(s)
data.PSG: Protective Service Security with Armed Guards - Motor service for Protective Security Service when shipper requires one or both cleared drivers be armed
data.PUK: Pack and Unpack - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to provide packing services at the origin location and unpacking services at destination site; including labor, packing material, and containers; as part of a household goods shipment
data.PVS: Stop-offs for Privately Owned Vehicle Shipment
data.PVT: Privately Owned Vehicle in Truckaway Service
data.RC: Railroad Controlled Private Equipment Subject to Demurrage - Equipment subject to paragraph #1 of tariff RPS6004 item 765 - allowing private equipment to be subject to demurrage when authorized by equipment owner
data.RCC: Reconsignment - Change in destination, route, etc., that requires a change in billing or an additional movement of the shipment
data.RCL: Redelivery - Motor service when, through fault of the consignee, delivery cannot be made and has to be redelivered at a later date
data.RIE: Released Value Charge in Excess of Carrier Maximum Liability
data.RLS: Relocation of Vehicle - Motor service when carrier is requested to move a vehicle from one platform doorway or shipping room to another
data.RMS: Rail Surveillance - Rail security service performed by rail carriers in the movement of Government unclassified sensitive cargo
data.RR: Rear Rider - Operational restrictions require equipment to be run on the rear of a train only
data.RSP: Reshipment - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to prepare a household goods shipment for onward movement when the shipment is diverted to a new destination location
data.RSS: Restricted Speeds - Service when the unusual nature of the shipment requires the carrier to operate at speeds below its normal limits
data.RSV: Reservations - Shipper may reserve space in a vehicle for second and third Proviso commodities moving via Household Goods motor carriers only
data.SCC: Special Containers - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to use specially constructed containers for oversized or fragile items as part of a household goods shipment
data.SDS: Special Dromedary Service - Demountable shipping container (special sizes) that can be fastened to the chassis of a truck, tractor, or flat bed
data.SEE: Stairs, Elevator, Excess Carry - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to use stairs, elevators, or long carry as part of the origin or destination services on a household goods shipment
data.SFT: Special Train Movement - Rail service when a special train is necessary due to excessive dimensions, weight, or safety of the shipment
data.SI: Ship to Cross Dock or Pool
data.SKT: Skirting and Unskirting - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to remove skirting from the mobile home prior to movement and reinstalling the skirting at destination after the transportation from one location to another has been performed
data.SNM: Transmit a Ship Notice/Manifest Transaction Set
data.SNT: Shipment from Non-Temp Storage - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to perform pickup and inspection of household goods from a long term storage facility
data.SOC: Stop-off - Service for stop-off in transit to complete loading or to partially unload a shipment
data.SPR: Spreader Service - Carrier responsible for spreading product at point of delivery
data.SPT: Spot for Storage - No Shipment - Carrier required to provide a trailer for shipper although no shipment is available for assignment
data.SPU: Split Pickup - Service for pickup/delivery of articles in a single shipment at more than one place within the origin/destination
data.SRG: Storage - Service for freight held in carrier's possession beyond free time for any reason not the fault of the carrier
data.SRS: Surveying Routes - Service when, because of the unusual size or weight of the shipment, a survey of the route is required for its safety
data.SSN: Substitute Service Not to be Used
data.SUA: Spot for Unloading from A End - Car is to be spotted for unloading of vehicles from the A end of the autorack
data.SUB: Spot for Unloading from B Brake End - Car is to be spotted for unloading of vehicles from the "B" (brake) end of the autorack
data.SUP: Supervisor Requested - Carrier must provide a person to supervise loading or unloading
data.SVS: Storage of Vehicles - Service for vehicles trailer or flat car held by carrier, beyond the free time allowed, for any reason not the fault of the carrier
data.SW: Stretch Wrap - A high-tensile film, stretched and wrapped repeatedly around a unitized load to secure and maintain unit integrity.
data.TF: Trailer, Factory Load - Full trailer, not to be opened for consolidation
data.TMS: Multi-Tank Surveillance Service - Service for security service performed by railroads applicable when two M1 tanks are loaded on a rail car
data.TPS: Third Party Service - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to obtain independent contractors or companies to perform certain services on a household goods shipment that are not covered under an existing commercial or military tariff and the carrier is entitled to recover expenses or costs
data.TRA: Tractor Only - Carrier required to provide tractor only
data.TRL: Trailer Preparation - Special - Carrier required to prepare the trailer in accordance with special shipper requirements
data.TRM: Termination - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to terminate the movement of a household goods shipment at origin or enroute to a destination location
data.TRN: Transfer Product - Carrier required to provide labor and equipment to transfer product
data.TRP: Tire Repair and Replace - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to repair or replace military member-owned tires and/or tubes used on a mobile home
data.TRT: Tractor and Trailer - Carrier required to provide tractor and trailer only
data.UL: Unload from Left Side of Car - Left side of car determined by facing the "B" (brake) end of car
data.UPK: Unpacking - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to perform unpacking services on an unaccompanied baggage shipment that are not covered under the carrier filed transportation rate
data.UR: Unload from Right Side of Car - Right side of car determined by facing the "B" (brake) end of car
data.URC: Unloading or Reloading - Service when carrier is required to perform loading/unloading of a shipment unassisted by shipper/consignee
data.US: Shipper Certifies Gross Weight under 240,000 pounds
data.UTL: Utilities Disconnect and Connect - The additional service charge or order for a transportation carrier to disconnect utilities attached to a mobile home prior to movement and reconnect utilities at destination after transportation from one location to another has been performed
data.VAC: Vacuum Service - Carrier required to provide vacuum service
data.VFN: Vehicles Furnished But Not Used - A vehicle is delivered to the shipper, but is not used
data.VIS: Vehicles Inoperable - Applies when a vehicle cannot be driven under its own power onto the carrier's conveying equipment
data.VSO: Stop Off Delivery of Personal Vehicles
data.VTS: Vehicles in Truckaway - Service when vehicles, before loading in truckaway service, exceed 64" in height measured from ground to top of vehicle
data.WB: Wide-Body Pickup Truck (Applies to Finished Vehicle Loading
data.WDS: Waterfront Delivery - Service for waterfront delivery of bulk fuel
data.WTV: Weight Verification - Service for weight verification when the difference between billed weight and actual weight is less than 5 percent
